Reviews.Title: “Labor Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: jeffroy34
Reviews.Content: This property could use a remodel to bring it into 2012, however, those are things that did not affect my stay. Tried to check in very early and room was not ready, but front desk staff called me at 1pm to let me know it was available. Housekeeping staff were some of the most pleasant people I have experienced as compared to chain properties. Skipjack Grill was okay for quick drink before dinner and for breakfast buffet. Got my money's worth on buffet as my 3 year old was able to eat for free with my buffet purchase. Outdoor pool was what you would expect at an oceanfront property. Extremely pleased with room cleanliness and how quiet the room was. At $199/night for ocean front, I would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time in Ocean City Maryland”
Reviews.Author: RichDC-14
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a number of Boardwalk hotels in Ocean City MD and the Commander is a nice hotel. If you are looking for ultra modern and over-sized rooms, try someplace else. We stayed in an Ocean Front over looking the boardwalk. Good location, good view, nice room. The room has 2 smallish double beds and a double couch that opens. We were only 2 people so the room was of adequate size (although we slept in different beds as it was more comfortable that way). The room sleeps 6 but I would not try that with 6 adults and lots of luggage. The full sized refrigerator was nice to have as was the Microwave and counter top, good for bringing in take-out and breakfast but not for cooking. The hotel was not full and the service was good. We had an issue with a noisy AC unit and they sent someone to fix it quickly. All of the staff always was friendly and said hello when we encountered them. The Outdoor pool was nice and clean. We did not use the restaurant (Breakfast) or the pool bar/grill. We passed by the small indoor pool, again it looked clean but it is small. Parking was onsite but, they also have off site when the hotel is busy. We did not have any issues parking. It is a little pricy but it was in high season and we wanted a ocean front room. We would go back on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Unsatisfied and Very Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Donald D
Reviews.Content: I'll get right to the point. I, we were very unsatisfied and will never go back again, Went there for our 30 year wedding anniversery and it was the worst ever. Checked in like we were supposed to, took the elevator upstairs and the room was terrible. The room was not clean, the bed looked like it was just thrown togther and the ceiling which was once white seemed to be stained or had fungus growing everywhere. We have stayed in beachside hotels in many countries as well as California and I have to say this hotel didn't rate anywhere close to the others. Even though we paid what we did for the room we decided to check out two hours later and return back to Virginia the same day. What an anniversery. I made it up to her the next day with two dzen roses, a nice dinner in Washington DC and a request for another 30 years. I'd think twice about staying if I were anyone else who has never been there.

Reviews.Title: “i wasnt overall impressed.”
Reviews.Author: meia09
Reviews.Content: It was very dim in the room, even with the lights turned on, and the couch was plastic. We had stayed in the suite, which was barely a suite. It had 2 tv from a while ago, 2 small beds, a mini kitchen, and a plastic couch. the hallways smelled weird too, i was on floor 2 in room 151

Reviews.Title: “Dated hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: salkk1
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a one nights stay at the Commander Hotel. We stayed in the Cabanas overlooking the pool. Unfortunately our room overlooked a dirty roof of the pool bar. I cannot complain to much since they did accomadate us for just one night when they do have a two night minimum. Our room was large and did suit us well for the five of us. The bathroom was clean and large. The kitchen was not to well equipped but who wants to cook when there is great seafood all around the city. Unfortunately the guests before us left cheese wrappers in one of the cupboards and the maid must have missed them.I was dissappointed that the Skipjack Grill was not open for lunch. It would be so nice to sit there and overlook the beach and have some lunch. I was directed to the pool bar but the menu did not appeal to me. All in all it is a good place for families. I just wish there were not so many smokers in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Alicia G
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the oceanfront suites, room 752. Check in was fast. However,I was a little taken back at first by the attitude of one of the front desk employees, but the next day she was much friendlier. The room was clean and the view was awesome. Pictures just can't do it justice. We swam in the indoor pool after dark, which was pretty small. The location was great, nothing beats being so close to the boardwalk. We ate at the breakfast buffet twice, it would good and convenient but a little pricey. I would stay again, but I wouldn't mind checking out other locations as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: abt7777
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Cabanas overlooking outdoor pool which accommodated 6 very well (2 Queen and one double sofa bed). Could use updating but was clean overall. Location just at the edge of the 'real' activity on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty!!”
Reviews.Author: anonymous657
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed when we walked in was how dirty it was. There's a huge stain on the counter, stains all over the walls, stains on the chairs outside, and on the bathroom floor. The dishes in the drawers were dirty and made me not want to use them. The bathroom also smelled disgusting when I first got here, and there is MOLD growing on the back of the shower curtain. There are stains on our sheets as well. It's disgusting and makes me uncomfortable to stay in. Under the bed looks like it hasn't been cleaned in years. It was never this dirty before, I don't know what happened. It's completely unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: J G
Reviews.Content: The room was ok. Very small beds. I liked that there was a full sized refrigerator in the room. The balony was nice-we had an ocean front, second floor room. The price is high and you are paying for location because it is a good location to the beach and boards. You can park your car and not drive anywhere for the rest of the week. It is an older hotel and you can tell- there are some upgrades to make it more modern looking but the beds are definitely not queen beds and there is hardly any room for storing your clothes. My husband had to live out of his suit case because we had 2 drawers for clothes plus a clothing closet but there were only 3 hangers in this huge closet. We had a few issues but the staff took care of everything right away for us. The pool bar is a nice touch but pricey. The Skip Jack Grill has a nice breakfast buffet but it closes early and doesn't serve any other food.

Reviews.Title: “ocean city md by the broadwalk”
Reviews.Author: pmartin6234
Reviews.Content: just retur ned very pleasant stay at the Cabanas section of the hotel very nice room sizes beds could use an upgrade very friendly staff....nice outdoor pool .....centrally located right off the boards and beach will return again

Reviews.Title: “Needs maintenance throughout all rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Mollyknox
Reviews.Content: The carpet is falling apart which leaves nails sticking out. Good luck getting a working toilet. The staff is very young and rude. The only good thing about this hotel is the restaurant attached, which has a great breakfast buffet. The pool bar food is very over priced. The bathroom located beside the pool had toilet paper strewn everywhere. The pool was even closed for a day due to the health department not seeing the facility fit for the public!! Go somewhere else until this place gets its business together!

Reviews.Title: “vacation 2012”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda E
Reviews.Content: Recently sayed at The Commander < June 2012 with my grandson. Pleasant experience, the balcony was great when viewing the ocean. The only complaint I have is the commode seat had a crack in it....germ fest. The staff were very pleasant and helpful, expecially Jack and the young blond haired man on nightshift, thinking about staying at the Commander next summer. The guys renting the red sunbrella's were very rude. Enjoyed sitting on the benche at night and watching my grandson play in the sand, enjoyed the early morning bike riide. The best of times, was eating breakfast on the viranda with my Collin, and his friend Bryson, at the Slap Jack Bar & Grill. food was excellent, and the smell of the ocean was great. .

Reviews.Title: “Very warm & friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: nlfissel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Commander in May for Springfest weekend. This was our first time at the Commander and we were very pleased. Our room was an oceanfront suite on the sixth floor. The room was very clean and well kept. The only thing I was not fully satisfied with was the comfort of the mattresses. I certainly do not expect a plush five-star hotel bed, but these mattresses left a bit to be desired. We found all of the hotel facilities to be clean and presentable. Parking can be tight, but I know if I'm staying downtown parking is not real great no matter where you stay. This should catch no one by surprise if you have ever been to downtown OC before. All of the staff we encountered were exceptionally friendly, from the front staff, maintenance, bartenders, to housekeeping. We will surely return to the Commander!

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the boardwalk, wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: WillieDanielle
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at The Commander. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They were extremely courteous to our 2 and a half year old daughter. My in-laws also stayed, and they stayed in a handicapped room. The staff was helpful when my father-in-law needed help with doors, etc. We all felt like we were home away from home during our stay. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Zero customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Regan H
Reviews.Content: I love Ocean City and usually come down twice a year. I booked the Commander hotel for four nights. After reading the reviews and speaking with a friend who had recently stayed there who told me that her experience at the Commander was awful, I decided to cancel and stay somewhere else. I called to cancel and was told I would get a refund all but one night stay. Okay I understand this is policy and I was canceling six days before my scheduled date, so we decided to spend one night at the commander so we didn't lose any money. One extra night in Ocean City sounded great!!! I also wanted to see for myself if this hotel was as bad as its reputation. We had to check out of our hotel at 10:00 am. We could not check into the Commander until 3:00 pm. Understood we have some time to kill and we were hoping that maybe we could check in a little early because we have two small children.(I guess it was wrong of me to expect them to be a little hospitable) Alright we spend all day killing time, I called the commander around 1:30 to see if maybe our room might be ready. No Luck, but the kind lady at the front desk said we can park (three blocks away across a busy highway) and use the pool. Alright we will make the best of it, we parked got the kids dressed and hung out at the pool. 3:00 came and by this time we just want to go to our room, lay the kids down for a nap and relax. No our room is not ready yet. We were told by the kind lady at the desk that the most rooms are clean they were just waiting for them to be inspected but that have no clue how long it will be..... I was in the same boat as the other 25-30 people waiting in the lobby. I was a little disappointed but hey what can you do. Okay a half hour goes by and the nice lady at the front desk is replaced by a mean, unsympathetic older lady. I was told by other guest she was the manager, if that was true I can't imagine who would hire her as a manager she was rude and just downright unpleasant. So now forty-five minutes go by and rooms are starting to become available. A older gentleman just walks in cuts everyone off who have been waiting goes right up to the counter and says he booked five rooms and would like to be checked in. I bet your thinking she told him as soon as she gets to all the others who have been waiting, Nope she checks him in while everyone else is still waiting. In the meanwhile a guest came own and said they have been waiting quite a while for service, another employee at the desk tells him they know he needs service but 73 guest checked out today and they will get to him when they can. HELLO your a hotel, you know in advance how may people are checking in and out you should be prepared!!! Twenty five minutes later still waiting, the man with the five rooms is still at desk and his family keeps rolling in and going off to their rooms. The man is still checking in when his family members are now coming back down heading strait up to the counter, their keys were not working...... I had enough, I walked up to the desk kindly asked to cancel my room and for a refund. I didn't know if my room was ready yet or not, at this point I didn't care. The so called manager didn't say one word to me. Just grabbed my card out of my hand, I told her my name and she processed the refund and handed it back to me. No apology, No is there anything we can do to make this better, Nothing, not a word. I wish I cold give a review about the accommodation of this hotel, I wish I got to see more of this hotel but all I got to see was the lobby and the pool which looked nice. Overall It was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Still My First Choice!”
Reviews.Author: tojojijo
Reviews.Content: Honestly, are some of these people staying in the same Commander Hotel as I am? I love this place. We've stayed here for 12 years and have never had problems except for little things. And as soon as we call the front desk, it has been taken care of. We almost always have a Captains Suite, but also have stayed in one of the oceanfront rooms and it was just as nice. I also have a sensitivity to chemicals, so the housekeeping staff is well informed not to use the cleaning solutions in my room during my stay. The reservation people, (probably Pat!) makes sure they know. The only problem I have are when people who smoke don't follow the No Smoking rules (even on the balconies). Why is it that Smokers come to a non-smoking hotel? There are plenty of hotels that allow smoking, so why do they insist on smoking so that I can't open my windows, or sit on the balcony and enjoy the view/Ocean sound that I am paying for? That is taken care of too, when I call the front, they are quick with a gentle reminder of the non-smoking, or they will have a $500 fine. We visited the SkipJack bar this visit and Bunky is a great, personable bartender. He makes real drinks, not something from a mix. And can answer any question you may have. Don't be put off by some of the bad reviews here. If you come and have a room that's not up to what you expected, then ask for another one. If there is another of the same price range, I am sure they will be happy to fix the problem and switch you, but if they don't know about it, they can't fix it.

Reviews.Title: “The Commander came through”
Reviews.Author: spitz17325
Reviews.Content: I had made a reservation and through a error my reservation was wrong but they were more than generous in making up for the weekend , they made good on what could have been a terrible vacation so i must aknologe their willingness to do anything to make it right and for this you must try them out they will always be my favirote place . and i can never plug the Skipjack grill enough they have the best people working for them like Juila, Frannie , Garry , and Bucky and the list goes on , but my dearest thanks to Amanda who saved my familys vacation i am very greatful and i will always love the Commander thanks again .And i hope to see you all before the end of the summer .

Reviews.Title: “GREAT and CLEAN!”
Reviews.Author: Muriel S
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. The location was perfect. The staff was really nice and friendly. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because of the pull-out couch. My friends and I stayed in an OF suite and there were popcorn kernels under the sofa cushions. The hotel should include on their main website that they have free wi-fi, that's a great plus. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Location is great.....”
Reviews.Author: scherip
Reviews.Content: Location was very good, right on the boardwalk, Your typical family vacation 80's style room, complete with FULL SIZE refridg. the room was very dated, but clean, beds were very small, and kind of old... lots of towels provided.. the restaurant was open for breakfast but we didn't go.. no other restaurant service available during our stay, we had to go down the boardwalk. parking is very scarce on the immediate premises, but i believe that there is another lot about a block away. front desk was nice. the two double beds are really only good for one person each unless your teens.... but there was a pull out couch on the other side of the room. tv's are old,, but functional... i was told they jacked the prices up because it was a boat racing weekend, and this used to be the host hotel which we thought it was,,, we found out that its no longer the case, that they raised the prices because the racing people come to town, even though it was off season. and used to give us a discount. well they got greedy i was told and the racing organization moved the host hotel to another location.... most hotels were cheaper and for what you get this was not worth the price...

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: srd0716
Reviews.Content: We arrived late Friday, May 4th. Check in was very smooth & the only reason why I didn't give 5 out of 5 is because we had to park 2 blocks away in the overflow lot. The next morning we got up early for breakfast and were able to find a parking spot at the building. The indoor pool was very small so we didn't attempt to get in with our child. There wouldn't have been anymore room with the amount of people that were already there. It has great access to the boardwalk and the rooms were nicely decorated, enough space. We stayed in room 763 and it was an end unit on the oceanview side. We had a balcony that looked out to the boardwalk & ocean as well as balcony over the outdoor pool. I would definitely request this room again! We have stayed at the Fenwick Inn many times, but the last 2 times we stayed we had to call the police on domestic disturbances in the rooms next door. That place has gone down hill with service and individuals that stay there. We think we have found our new spot for quick off-season getaways at the Commander!

Reviews.Title: “American Flophouse”
Reviews.Author: Lynden R
Reviews.Content: American Flophouse: is a place that offers expensive lodging, generally by providing only minimal services. Couple this with the fact the Commander Hotel has no affiliation with the local BBB and a no refund policy, it supports the label of an American Flophouse. Very little available parking on the premises, worn out furniture and beds, and nappy carpet. Soap dispensers on the wall, rationed toilet paper and tissues. The Commander Hotel once represented the standard of a non-chain hotel on the boardwalk. Now it represents the Motel standard on the boardwalk. This hotel puts too much emphasis on “you’re paying for the privilege” to see the ocean and uses this as an excuse for charging high rates for a worn out room. The last time I looked at the ocean from the Commander, I noticed there were a lot of other rooms up and down the boardwalk. I recommend you check out some of these rooms and respective rates and you will be surprised what you get for your hard earned dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drob1121
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite hotels In OCMD. Stayed here a few times in the past and recently stayed there in the beginning of September 2011. Always clean and the staff is always professional. The location is great and not too far of a walk to the beginning of the boardwalk. Ocean front rooms are fantastic because the hotel is slanted towards the boardwalk....perfect view of the ocean/boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Good location!”
Reviews.Author: JTomo170
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research my wife and I decided on the Commander Hotel for our stay in Ocean City. Upon arrival the front desk adivsed us our ocean view room was unavailable and we had been upgraded to an ocean front at no additional charge. First thoughts of the hotel were good. The lobby is nothing spectacular but it was adequate. The room while appearing slightly dated was comfortable and well appointed. The view of the ocean of course was fantastic. This hotel has a great location! My wife and I did not explore much of the hotel so we can not really comment on the other ammenities but we would most definitely return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “The only redeeming quality is the view”
Reviews.Author: debpurn
Reviews.Content: If not for the view I would give this hotel zero stars. First issue was the smell. Noticed it first in the hallways and when we entered the room we couldn't believe the stench. I have no idea what was causing it. We had to keep the door to the balcony open to air out the room. We complained on our way out to the boardwalk and when we came back the stench was replaced by another, at least more pleasant, smell which unfortunately did not last. Second issue was with the bed. I could barely sleep the first night because the bed felt wet to me. My husband didn't notice so I thought it was just me. The next night he noticed it also. It was right after Hurricane Irene, maybe the rooms got wet? The carpet also felt damp. Parking is also an issue. Parking on site is limited and the second night we had to park at a deserted lot a few blocks away. Also, as a previous reviewer stated, there was a free-standing clothes closet with no hangars - what's the point of that? And the bedding had definitely seen better days. I could go on and on but I think you get the point. This is the first review I have ever left for a hotel because considering the price it should have been so much better. I have been going to Ocean City for over 20 years and this hotel has been the worst. I can't believe the people who have left good reviews. Maybe it depends what room you are in? I have noticed that great views get mentioned the most which is probably the only reason this place is still in business.

Reviews.Title: “The Ups compensate for the Downs”
Reviews.Author: L-Bolek
Reviews.Content: Repeated stay at the Captain's Suite 560 – and our second review of it. As before, the overall experience is great. We went the day after the town opened back from hurricane Irene’s visit, and stayed over the Labor day weekend. The hotel staff were able to refund our nights we did not use, and the check-in and general service experience was great. The hotel needs to have a facelift soon – just wear and tear over the years. We like our room for many reasons: the balcony, which is more like a deck – it is huge, and gives extra-space to park a stroller, and beach cart. We also had breakfasts and lunches on that balcony, relaxed after getting our toddler to sleep, and the view is excellent. We always try to stay in the Captain’s Suite for the reason of more space. The sofa opens to a nice size bed, which was used by our toddler. BUT the main bed NEEDS to be King size. It is just small for the suit and expectations. It would fit in the bedroom area, even if we have to “front-load” into it. But really, it should be king, not queen. Bathroom has a huge Jacuzzi tub, two showerheads, big general area, BUT absolutely no hooks, or shelf space. It gets pretty annoying, as most that you can keep on the counter is toothbrushes and towels (since there are no hooks to hang them). All personal items have to spread out into the rest of the room, and you look for them daily. And the lack of hand/bath soaps is a “down”. There is a dispencer for shampoo/bodywash in the tub, but that is kind of odd, and we found one little soap on the counter. Remembering this from before, we brought our own soap. But I don’t think that’s normal. The hotel should provide some soaps and other things (stationary for example) for a room, especially their top-level room. The kitchen area is great – big fridge, microwave oven, toaster, some forks&plates and such, corkscrew. No dishwasher, I washed some, and left some – the maid (VERY GOOD at taking care of us) did get them. But the kitchenette is very useful, especially for long stays like ours. The view – fantastic! The restaurant downstairs is okay for one breakfast, but we are not very thrilled with it. Service is excellent though. Also, it’s only open for breakfast, and then – drinks in the evening, which is kind of weird. Location of the hotel is perfect. Feet away from the beach, and in the middle of the great OC 2.25 mile long boardwalk. Which is just perfect – not too close to the carnival area, which gets quite loud and messy at busy weekend nights, and not too far for a stroll to down there. There is a pool, but we never used it. Parking is available around the hotel. We were lucky to always find a spot right next to the entrance, but in busier season I am guessing it is tougher. So altogether – I recommend staying here, and it is a better value (I think) than some of the nearby places. However, there are some quirks we keep noticing every time, and the hotel definitely will need some updating very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Captain's Suite was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Mark Y
Reviews.Content: I had a great time staying with my Fiance at the Commander. The most impressive part of the hotel was the wrap around balcony which allowed us to see the ocean and the bay at the same time! The front of the balcony has a lounger so you can lay and watch the ocean in the morning and the back of the balcony has a table and chairs. The temperature of the room was great because i like a cold room so i need to know the a/c is going to work! The second great part was the bathroom. The double shower heads and jacuzzi tub were a nice extra.

Reviews.Title: “We love staying at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Warren C
Reviews.Content: The entire experience was excellent from making the reservation to check-out. We have stayed here several times in recent years and have always been satisfied with the accomations, food at the grill, and the service. My wife and I especially like the convience of the Commander on the Boardwalk, because it is about in the middle of the boardwalk shops. We are planning to return to the Commander Hotel about the same tinme in 2012. Rev. Warren Cravotta

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean!!”
Reviews.Author: Bowieeaglesfan
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 stayed at the Commander Hotel for 4 days. Stayed in an ocean front room on the 4th floor. Room was just what it stated online. 2 full size beds and one sofa bed with a balcony and small kitchenette. Air conditioner worked too well ("LOL"). It was nice leaving the balcony door open all night to hear the waves crashing....awesome!!! Room was very nice and clean. Bathroom was clean and shower was fantastic. Water pressure in shower was so good. It soothed you after a day at the beach. Maid was aware we had 6 adults in room so she gave us extra everything from towels to toilet tissue. Staff was very nice from Ms. Debbie at the front desk to "Big Joe" who worked for the Commander (awesome smile and great great attitude) to the bald white guy (can't remember his name) who so graciously found us a parking space when we came in late Friday night after going to the Ocean Downs Casino 10 min. away. We took 4 cars (adult children came at different times) and had really no problem finding parking spaces. Hotel was on the boardwalk and we stepped right out to the beach. Can't get any better than that. Had a fun time at the pool after the huge waves beat us up ("LOL"). Pool was really fun and relaxing with the bar right there. We will go back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great ocean view.”
Reviews.Author: edster606
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the top floor and you can't beat the view from the balcony. It is on the quiet end of the Boardwalk. Very relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Commander Inn apartments great for graduated seniors”
Reviews.Author: oliviabrooke4862
Reviews.Content: 5 friends and myself stayed in the apartments owned by the commander hotel and were plesantly surprised by the rooms after looking at the less than impressive pictures online. The apartments was quaintly decorated and made us all feel at home. Its great for senior week kids, and probably familes as well. The kitchen was great and the beds were comfortable. Overall the place seemed clean and well kept. For a group of 18 year old girls living on their own for the first time, it really seemed like home. 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “nice with just a few minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: TYRRELL_10
Reviews.Content: we stayed in room 555 oceanview suite, the room was good size and nicely decorated, had no problems with it...the first day i left the maid a tip of 5.00 and all she did was make the beds, the next day i left less and she did alot more ..not sure what that was about . The beds are really hard, my husband thought it was fine, i like a little softer lol,,,ok my big complaint >>> the restraunt "skipjack grill" we had breakfast one day and that was it ...not very good especially for the price, the buffet looked disgusting so we ordered ala carte and it tasted funny, the best breakfast by far is at the brass saloon just a little bit down the boardwalk, not far at all.. the other thing about the skipjack, when i was at the beach and wanted a nice drink the bar was not opened until i think 5pm, the bar at the pool is open at 11am and that was very nice, but its out by the road in back of the building :( other than that we had a great time and i really liked the hotel

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and for next Jun we hope to be back”
Reviews.Author: lovethebeach080
Reviews.Content: We were on the side view it was small but for just the two of us it was great for a few days stay...We love the deck with the rockers we could sit and just relax for awhile then get up and walk on the board walk... Debbie at check in was so soft spoken and wanted to help you for a room that you would like...She was great...The towels need to be a little softer..but for the money we were Happy...The only thing is we wanted to stay a extra night and our room was taken for the next day..We looked at a room that was more than what we wanted to pay ...they didn't offer us a discount since we were already guest in the hotel..We thought they should have...So we checkout and paid another day at another Hotel :( But all in all it was nice but the one we stayed in after check out even gave us a discounted price for seniors

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!! Got more than what we expected!!!”
Reviews.Author: Krislynell
Reviews.Content: We booked on line for an ocean front room for our party of 6. (4 adults, 2 children) and we checked in late Friday May 6th and stayed until Sunday May 8th. First off, the room was clean and nicely laid out. Secondly, the balcony on the 3rd floor and the view fromt it was amazing!!!! The location was great, we walked everywhere and the Skip Jack Grill on the first floor had a great breakfast buffet. The only thing we werent thrilled about was the indoor pool is small (but it was just us in the pool so size didnt matter). After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, we werent so sure, but it was really great and we will definetly stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-low cost-prime location”
Reviews.Author: jrboct24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 4/29-5/1/11 and again we were pleasantly satisfied with this hotel. This was our 2nd stay here and each time the hotel personnel were very helpful, courteous and polite. The hotel is an older hotel but the management has kept it very clean and updated. Our room was fully supplied with kitchen necessities and our view was wonderful. I called ahead to request a room away from the restaurant and the front desk placed us into the perfect room. We will definitely stay again and recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Close enough, clean enough, good enough”
Reviews.Author: markap
Reviews.Content: Basically, a subpar hotel compared to the other hotels I've stayed at in Ocean City. The room we stayed at had 2 beds and a kitchen. We wanted a kitchen cause we wanted to be able to cook there. The kitchen looked kinda like a bathroom. It's not as clean and neat looking as one would have expected. I suspected there are some hidden pests there judging from the looks of the cabinets inside. We stayed for two days and it was good enough for our needs. It's not waterfront but it's not that far away from the boardwalk either. There were a bunch of us sharing the room but sleeping wasn't a problem since there were a lot of other couches. We had a balcony, which is where we basically spent most of our time while at the hotel. The room inside does not look welcoming at all, like it's such an old and unkempt place. Overall, it was ok and tolerable for a two night stay especially because it's the cheapest one we've found on a short notice.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for a totally average, dark and uninviting room”
Reviews.Author: Annie0922
Reviews.Content: What is good about this hotel-the location is oceanfront on the boardwalk. Shower pressure was very good. The room was clean. The front desk personnel are friendly. (Although, we had a small issue at check-in and the manager was rude.) Cafe and bar located in hotel.(did not use) Now for the unpleasantries- We had an oceanfront suite. (Does not in any way compare to the Holiday Inn Oceanfront in Ocean City. ) The room was dark, smelled musty, the toilet smelled of sewer, the balcony was too small, the decor was very outdated, the couch was vinyl, the beds were uncomfortable. No complimentary soap bars or shampoo/lotion bottles,etc. There was a "Sysco" dispenser in the shower with a substance that was a combo of shampoo and soap (no conditioner). Hair dryer barely worked. Overall the hotel was so dark and uninviting. The hotel owner (s) need to invest money into updating the decor and creating a more inviting, light, airy, fresh, clean, relaxing atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Totally ripped off”
Reviews.Author: OCMDvacationer
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Commander. The first time was great. This time.... NOT SO GREAT!!! We had a clogged toilet 5 minutes after check-in that took two maintenance men over 3 hours to fix (because they disassembled the whole thing instead of just plunging it), a broken sofa bed, wobbly chair, and a hair dryer that shot a flame out of it when we turned it on! And the Skipjack grill is NO better! We went for happy hour. Ordered our first round of food (which was frozen pizzas and hot dogs). When it came out we ordered more for people that were going to be joining us. Waited 45 minutes and it never came! Plus there were only 3 other people at the skipjack at the time! Needless to say this was an awful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Second time and looking forward to a third...”
Reviews.Author: 17mcal
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here and both times we were on the 14th Street side and our view was very nice and the rooms were lovely and clean. Although, I do agree with some of the other visitors that the beds could be updated. The televisions were fine, people don't realize what a wasteful expense it would be to replace working TVs for flatscreens. The hotel has a great location and we've always enjoyed all the options within walking distance. We would highly recommend your hotel and look forward to next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but could use some new beds”
Reviews.Author: FuseCrew
Reviews.Content: All in all, loved the place. Outdoor pool just right for the kids, right on the boardwalk, surrey rental right next door. The beds leave MUCH to be desired though, very unfirm (seen its better day, I believe). Please install a ceiling fan in the bedroom portion of the Oceanfront suite, it will go far in keeping the temperature in the room consistent with the front (where the A/C is). Staff was wholly attentive and helpful, no complaints there at all. We asked for extra towels & they were brought within 5 minutes. Breakfast is good, pool bar closed @ 5pm (when the inside bar opened: I guess the same staff members work both places). Great views from our 5th floor oceanfront room...sunrise & sunset were awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.Worst bed I have EVER...”
Reviews.Author: CampHiker
Reviews.Content: Good location. Worst bed I have EVER slept in. Staff that could have cared less.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Teenagers”
Reviews.Author: Fungaw55
Reviews.Content: We had an oceanfront room with two double beds and a fold-out "plastic" couch. The room was small but since we used it only for sleeping and showering it met our needs for our three day trip. The room was clean and quiet. Once we arrived and parked the car, we never moved the car until we checked out. This place was very convenient for the beach, boardwalk attractions, bikes, mini-golf, and restaurants. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would have rather stayed at a funeral home, then this depression.”
Reviews.Author: Gems398
Reviews.Content: Dont waste your money on this place. I cant believe they call this place a hotel! It was dirty and depressing. The indoor pool (if thats what you want to call it), was more on the size of shoebox and had a dirty greenish look. The outside pool was dirty looking with sand and something that looked like fecal matter. The halls were painted depressing colors and had a musty odor. The rooms were so outdated. The beds were horribly unconfortable. This hotel is such low class, they are to cheap to put toiletries in the bathroom so they put soap dispensers by the sink and shower. The staff was about as cold as an iceburg. We felt very uncomfortable and couldnt wait to leave. Bates Motel from the Alfred Hitchcock movie had more charm then this place.

Reviews.Title: “The Commander Hotel is in the perfect location on the boardwalk!”
Reviews.Author: VGlassGlenside
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Commander hotel August 3rd to August 7th (4 nights). After reading some of the mixed reviews here, I wanted to see what our experience would be like...well here are my thoughts in no particular order: check-in was smooth and we were worried about finding a parking space--but found an excellent one in the shade right under the hotel (easy to put in boogie boards, shovel, pail, etc..after going to beach for day)--the trick appears to look for a spot around dinner time (anywhere from 4-7) and we had no problem a few days later when we drove to Splashworld waterpark at 30th and Coastal Highway, and got back around 4 p.m.--and someone was pulling out for dinner!! We did not eat at the SkipJack Grille. We asked for towels each day from the housekeeper and she was very nice about exchanging them. The Commander is right between 2 great restaurants--to the left is DaVinci's--very good Italian food--and great sandwiches at lunchtime--and to the right is Phillips by the Sea--it was great sitting right by the window--broiled seafood combination was tasty. We also ate at the Harrison Harbor Watch at end of boardwalk overlooking the inlet--it was very deliciious--about a 45 minute walk to the restaurant from the Commander. We also enjoyed Kohr's softserve (tastier than Dumser's for sure)--rented a surrey bike and biked up the boards to a java cafe near 24th I believe and our son enjoyed a Krispy creme donut for breakfast. We also played a lot of carnival games, visited the Kite loft, went into Marty's Playland and the Funcade Casino where you can play skeeball and other games which give you tickets to exchange for different stuff (what child doesn't enjoy this...?!). The hotel outdoor pool was very nice with a zero entry and it was clean. The indoor pool was a little green looking and it was too humid inside. The only complaint was the oceanfront suite view--we were on the second floor right over the roof for the skipjack grille and that did obstruct our view so I would strongly recommend that you ask for a higher floor away from the skipjack grille roof! We now know that you need to ask for this when you make your reservation. It was too late when we checked in--as they were sold out. We walked everywhere and only took the tram once when it was lightening and thundering just to take us to a dry place. On the boardwalk at night, there were several street performers (people who looked like statues, performed magic and comedy and music) We brought breakfast food and used the fridge, toaster and coffee pot which was very convenient. Finally, we put the a/c down to 65 before we went to sleep and it cooled the whole room nicely. So, the bottom line is that we would stay here again but on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “As Good as Advertised”
Reviews.Author: CSINY
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend at the Commander. We had a Promenade suite. It was just as advertised. The room was very nice sized and clean. We had a patio outside the room and next to the sun deck and within steps of the Skipjack Grille. Breakfast on the patio of the Grille was good food and great views. Later on that day we enjoyed the Happy Hour. We were steps away from the Boardwalk and beach. We took advantage of both. The location is great. The staff was friendly, cooperative, thoughtful and professional. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will gladly return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Overall liked, but pool bar had no entertainment and shut down too early”
Reviews.Author: ohiolpn02
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Cabana rooms in front of pool. The room was nice and clean. The carpet needs cleaned. The bathroom was very roomy with bathtub plus shower stall. Also there was an entrance foyer where you store more things. The balcony was large with hanging racks for towels. The bed was extremely comfortable and I slept great! We had queen sized beds which is a big plus. We stayed on the 2nd floor which was convenient for laundry and ice. Its a $1.50 the wash and same to dry. The ironing board is located in laundry room and not the room you stay in. Our ice machine was broken. The door to our room didn't shut all the way which we were gone all day and found it wasn't even locked when we returned. Nothing was missing. Having a full size fridge was very nice. There was a mini stove top, but there wasn't a large size pot to cook something like pasta. There weren't very any cooking utencils. They have dishes but the bowls are very small. I suggest you buy styrofoam bowls for cereal. We saved alot of money by packing lunch on beach everyday. We went to the local Food Lion and bought very good lunchmeat (we are very picky with quality of food). I like to pack beer for the beach, but they do have a very strict no alcohol policy. It is a $500 fine and arrest. You have to drink your alcohol on the premises (bar) where it was purchased. You cannot carry it up the boardwalk or to the beach. We popped popcorn on the stove top with Jiffy popcorn and 15 minutes later the entire hotel fire alarm went off. We didn't even burn the popcorn, so we were a little stunned that they thought we set it off. Even though they thought we set off the alarm, they were very nice about it. The staff (maintenance, front desk, housekeeping) was very pleasant and helpful. Parking is a major issue. We had to park on the street most of the time. The beach bar was nice and served drinks and food, however was open very long. I'm not sure, but I think they opened around 11 or 12 and closed by 5. We were very disappointed that the pool closed at 8pm. We felt that was way too early and should be open til at least 10 or 11. The pool area was very clean but could use some more umbrellas. The beach was clean with a lifeguard on duty. The water was VERY cold, and it had been 103 degrees out when we were there. Once you got in, it was ok, but it was hard to get used to at first. The lifeguard shut down around 600 or 700 and would call everyone out of the water. They strongly suggests you don't swim without lifeguard on duty, the waves are pretty intense. We spent our days at the beach and nights on the boardwalk. There is a tram that you can pay $3 to use all day. We walked and got alot of exercise. Everything on the boardwalk was open til around 12am, some places such as pizza places and other food places stayed open. Bathrooms are a bit of an issue on the boardwalk. They are pretty far apart and none of the stores we went into had restrooms. My suggestion is, if you really have to go, is to go into a restaurant and order a drink and use their restroom. One night I sat on boardwalk by the bathroom house (which was closed at 12 am) and watched people begging the people inside to open the door so they could go, but the lights went out and no one opened the door. At that time there was a ton of people on boardwalk and alot of food places open that didnt have restrooms. I really think bathrooms should stay open until the entire boardwalk is shut down. Food on the boardwalk was a little pricey, especially sit down meals. Cigarettes were $8.35 a pack. You could get pizza fairly priced for $3 a large slice. Be sure if you order a pizza sub to ask if it has meat on it. We ordered a pizza sub and it was just sauce and cheese on a bun. The ocean view grill which is just a couple blocks up had DELICOUS baby back ribs. Overall we enjoyed our stay, but considering we like a little more entertainment on our hotel site such as music at bar/pool area and things to be open a bit later, we most likely will check out another hotel the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Captain's Suite is the place to be!”
Reviews.Author: holidaystuff
Reviews.Content: Booked the Captain's Suite for 4 nights, mostly for the size of the balcony, which is FANTASTIC for the expansive view of the ocean. There was care taken with the decor and bathroom (jacuzzi tub, 2 shower heads). The odd all-in-one soap dispenser in the tub was odd, but we always travel with our own stuff anyway so it was not a big deal for us. The little "kitchen" was an excellent addition to the room. The bed was a bit uncomfortable, hard, and the sleeper sofa mattress had seen better days. Still, this was not enough to detract from our enjoyment of this room. The southern exposure was wonderful, as it enabled us to open all windows and the door at all times, we didn't use the A/C at all. All staff we encountered was friendly and helpful. The outside pool was sparkling. The deck with lounges and chairs fronting the boardwalk gave more outside options. We wanted to stay an extra day, and choose the Navigator Suite for the southern exposure. It was very large and nice, but we were spoiled by the view from the Captain's Suite. Looked into an oceanfront suite on the way out of the hotel and it seems like the bed area (far from the ocean end of the room) would be hot, even with the A/C. But the living room area was lovely. All in all, I would return to this hotel in a heartbeat, and stay in the Captain's Suite!

Reviews.Title: “Carefree and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: ldasunshine
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we have stayed at the Commander and it was as pleasurable as the first time. All the staff is friendly and accomodating, the room was clean and attended to daily. The entire hotel, pools and grounds are well kept and show that there is pride in its appearance.........certainly a reflection of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and staff were great...parking is issue for handicapped persons”
Reviews.Author: paw5454
Reviews.Content: I took my grandchildren there for the 4th of July and to experience the fireworks on the beach. The hotel was clean and room was comfortable, but when you walked into the room there was a hint of a "musty smell", but it wasn't overpowering. We were oceanfront view so we had a fantastic view of the ocean and boardwalk. We could just walk out the hotel and catch the train if we wanted to. The hotel staff were so kind from the time we arrived until we left. The only drawback I had was the parking situation. There really aren't many spaces to park right at the hotel, but 2 blocks down the street is another lot to park in for the hotel, which is where I had to park. I am handicapped so it did make it alittle difficult to get back to the hotel...maybe they need to have a few more handicap spaces avaliable.

Reviews.Title: “minimal value for dollars worst beds we ever slept in”
Reviews.Author: lcyukon
Reviews.Content: The Commander Hotel is a low end Hotel with a coat of paint on it. The beds in the room were the worst beds anyone in my family has ever slept on, and we go camping in tents! The entire box springs collapses on the sides when you sit on the edge of the bed. The air conditioning is in serious need of upgrading, it does not reach the bedroom area of the long narrow room. The decor would be quaint and reminiscent of a by gone era hote, except the era is gone and all that has been upgraded is the paint in the room. The hotel was not dirty, but it was only superficially clean. The pool looks lovely in the pictures, but in reality the water was not clear and has some type of oil pooling on the surface and we never saw the fountain in working order. The one lovely feature was a very nice outside bar/grill area with very pleasant staff. There is a sweet restaurant on the property but it is only open for breakfast and then shifting evening hours at the bar. Overall would say the Hotel is OK, but definately not worth the Boardwalk prices. My family has stayed in Ocean City every year for 20 years and this is one of the few Hotels I would say that we would not return to for the value on the dollar. (Although it does explain why we were able to book a partial week during a holiday week.)

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: hhundley2003
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not what they show in the picture. We stayed in the oceanfront suite and it looked like colonial times. The beds were falling apart. Our vehicle was broken into while it was parked in the garage and they do not have a camera system and the guard does not make regular rounds. For the money you pay to stay there it is not worth it. The restaurant doesn't have set hours and you never know when they will be open. I would reccommend staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was very nice, food not so much”
Reviews.Author: soldierdoll
Reviews.Content: The Commander Hotel was very nice and clean. We stayed in a ocean view room and it was wonderful, the view and the room were great. I loved the fact that there was a fridge, sink and microwave in the room for the family. The only problem we had was when we dined for dinner at the hotel's outside restaurant. The service was very slow, the menu was very limited (burgers & fries) and the food wasn't very good for the price. We all had burgers and we could have gotten a better meal at burger king for 1/4 the price. Also, our drinks were never refilled and the people at the table next to us were not even approached by wait staff for 15 minutes. Its a nice bar with a great view of the beach, its too bad the service & food is so crappy. Compared to the hotel, the restaurant was way under par. We go to ocean city, MD every year and I hope to stay at the Commander again next year but, will not eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location with limited parking!”
Reviews.Author: g-unit2010
Reviews.Content: The family wanted to do a quick trip to the beach to view this year's fireworks and even with a lack of decent parking and huge crowds our enthusiam was hi! The 5th floor Captain's suite we stayed in was clean and comfortable for our party of four and the kids loved the expansive balcony. Proximity to the beach was great, noise levels were acceptable, didn't try the restaurant, but it seemed to be not well visited. Ocean water was very chilly, the hotel pool was cold as well, but clean and had easy access. Front desk personnel were kind, but offered no response to their parking or lack of same. All and all I would stay again at the Commander though it seemed a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “All around great place!”
Reviews.Author: Jaydensgrammy
Reviews.Content: We reserved a cabana room. Great location to the beach, right on the boardwalk, 14th street. Parked under our bldg, was able to leave sandy play items in our trunk and get them on the way back to the beach the next day. Quite roomy, comfy bed, a shower and a tub. Our own balcony, over looking the pool, with a table and chairs to eat our meals on outside. Rooms were clean, decorated very nicely--bed linens and wall decorations matched the blinds on the patio windows, very "beachy". Nice, new FULL size refrigerator, plenty of kitchen items to utilize. Had a problem with the key machine upon check in, they had a maid let us in our room, then they brought the working keys to us. Also, had a problem with the remote control on the TV, such a minor problem and a maintenance man was there with in 10 minutes. He had a new remote and programed it before he left and he apologized for the problem. Great place , great location, great staff, indoor and out door pool, in case of rain, if you go with little ones.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely going to Return”
Reviews.Author: SueRobG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our recent stay at the Commander. We had an Oceanfront Suite and it was wonderful. We finally found a boardwalk hotel that we will definitely return to. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Everyone was always smiling and they always acknowledged you no matter what time of day. The cleaning staff, as well, did the same thing. We didn't feel like "just another guest" here. The rooms were very clean. What I also liked was that even though it was on the boardwalk, you were not disturbed by boardwalk noise. Oh, and the pool bar staff was awesome as well, can't forget about them !!!:) Definitely looking forward to our return!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like my home away from home”
Reviews.Author: lawsonpix
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The staff was incredibly friendly! I'll bet they actually LIKE their job! A rare find in most service industries. The decoration was cute and local. Not high brow and snooty. Family oriented and priced to compete with the many other hotels on the beach. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssmcdonald
Reviews.Content: The staff was nice and the room was very nice. The cleaning staff was wonderful. I would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean hotel with courteous staff.”
Reviews.Author: BaltimorePenguinfan
Reviews.Content: It was the off season but it was quiet and such a pleasant experience. Great view from our room of the ocean and would absolutely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “would not want to stay anywhere else in o.c.”
Reviews.Author: msopinion
Reviews.Content: it has been awhile since we have been able to visit o.c. but we have stayed at the commander 7 or 8 of our 10 or 12 vacations. we usually stay 4 or 5 nights. our only complaint, one year, was that our balcony was to close to the roof below us, obstructing our view, as we love sitting out at night and watching the activities on the boardwalk. we are looking forward to vacationing in o.c. this summer and to staying at the commander.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Renovated Boardwalk Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mapper65
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 years in a row. The place seems to get a bad rap by some people on tripadvisor but it's better than the ratings most people give it. It may not be as nice as some of the brand new hotels but it is what it is. A renovated hotel is typically never quite as nice and a brand new modern hotel. The staff has always been friendly and the room is always cleaned very well. On this trip I went to the breakfast buffet the first morning around 10am and stuff didn't seem quite as fresh as I would have liked it to be. The toast was hard and dry and the eggs looked like they had been out for a while. I went to breakfast around the same time on the morning I was leaving and everything was fine. Not sure why the difference but I'm glad I went the second time and gave them another chance. I was a little disappointed in a down economy that the price went up this year. If the price goes up too much next year, I'll stay somewhere else, if not I'll probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No matter what the weather!”
Reviews.Author: beachbumPenna
Reviews.Content: It was sunny, windy, and rainy, we had it all. My nephews swam in the inside pool while it rained. We hung out by the outside pool when it was sunny. We had a great breakfast at Skipjacks restaurant. The boardwalk is close enough to people watch from our balcony. But did'nt miss any action on the street below. It's perfectly positioned to get wherever you wanna go. I recommend the Cabanna rooms. They are too much fun, sleep a lot of people if needed, and have a personality. Great for a budget minded family cooking some meals at "home". The kitchen is stocked. I've stayed there several times and have never been disapointed. I really like it. Staying around 14th street is centrally located for the whole family. I've gotten several friends to stay there and got a thank you for my effort! They liked it too! Deb

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: gigi49050
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel. I stayed in an oceanfront room which were steps away from the boardwalk. I also visited this hotel years ago, but I stayed in the Cabana building. Between the two, I would recommend the Cabana. The Cabana rooms have a pool view but the rooms are more open and have a much larger balcony. The other downside is the hotel does not provide an iron/ironing board in the room, so you must bring your own iron. Guests also have to travel to different floors within the hotel to use the ice machine and laundry facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great time...great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bandgmom
Reviews.Content: This was our second year in a row we decided to stay in OC at The Commander for a long weekend. The staff is very courteous and extremely helpful. The hotel was completely booked, so we had to take a smoking room on the Cabana side. They went out of their way to clean the room with special cleaners and we could not tell it was a smoking room! The rooms are very clean and spacious.Great get away at a great place within walking distance to everything you need. I just wish the outdoor pool and pool bar stayed open longer and they had irons and ironing boards in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay in a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: classicalone
Reviews.Content: This is from the email I sent to the Commander upon returning from my trip a couple of days ago: "We enjoyed our stay at the Commander Hotel. We found the hotel to be completely comfortable and very nice. The rooms were roomy and light; the AC worked well; there was plenty of hot water and good water pressure; the maids cleaned the rooms very well each day. I appreciated having the in-room safe to keep my camera and Ipod and cash. The view from the balcony was great. The rooms were also quite quiet. If we come back to OC again, we will almost definitely be booking our rooms at the Commander again." When we decided to go to OC for a few days with our daughter, SIL, and grandkids, I knew I wanted to stay on the boardwalk. I began reviewing hotels. Wow - all hotels had a lot of negative reviews, even if they also had lots of good reviews. So I began reading the reviews and I found that it seemed most of the negative reviews about the Commander were for things I didn't think would bother us very much. So I reserved two suites, one for my husband and me, the other for daughter and her family. I warned them all that there were a lot of negative reviews, but I thought it sounded like we'd be ok. I'm glad I made that decision. All four of us adults agreed that the Commander was a very nice place to stay. Everything I said in my email back to them (above in quotes) was true. If you're an extremely picky, finiky, difficult to please person, then no - don't stay there - stay at the most expensive hotel in OC, whatever that is, and maybe you'll be happy. If you're a normal person- go ahead and stay at the Commander.

Reviews.Title: “The Commander is excellent as always”
Reviews.Author: furnitureman_9
Reviews.Content: This was our third year staying at the Commander, after reading some of the reviews, we wondered if things could have changed that much in a years time. We arrived on Saturday afternoon, before check in time and Pat at the desk told us we could use the pool area and she would call my cell phone when the room was ready. We had lunch at the pool bar and enjoyed the sun, and soon we had a call to check in. We extended our stay one day without any hassel at all. The Staff from the pool boy to the maids to the desk personal were all great and as helpfull as they could be. We always stay in a Cabanna and found it very clean, and inviting. We use the in room safe to put any thing of value ( including money) and have NEVER had a problem. Our stay has always. and was again this year quiet and very pleasant. Keep up the good work !!!!! Oh yes parking can sometime be a problem, but this year we had none.

Reviews.Title: “Very Handicap accessible...spacious suite.....friendly staff.....”
Reviews.Author: frid74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in an Oceanview Suite. The hotel actually called me after I booked because I had booked online and sent a message that I would be traveling with my father, who is 86 and in a wheelchair. They called to advise me that they had a handicap accessible suite that included safety bars in the bathroom (by the toilet and in the tub). I appreciated them telling me, as it was not mentioned on the website and they gave us that suite at no additional charge. The room was clean and very spacious. The bathroom was very big and my father could get in the door and move about in his wheelchair with ease. My sister and I (who traveled with him and who also have some mobility problems) appreciated the additional safety handles as well. It was very quiet and you did not hear a lot of noise from the other rooms, the hall, or outside. The full size refrigerator, sink, coffee pot, etc. was an added bonus. The only problem we saw was that the balcony was small and had a regular door and not a sliding door. It made it hard for my father to get out there and shut the door, as well. Also, the a/c is in the sitting area and it seemed to get hot in the bedroom area for us. Especially since my father is always cold and turned it down on us. However, when it was time to leave he commented that he wished we could stay a few more days. I think he really enjoyed our "Family Vacation" and none of us thought the few inconveniences to be that horrendous. I have stayed at higher priced hotels that had a lot less going for them. I look forward to booking my next trip to Ocean City and staying at the Commander.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: westymom
Reviews.Content: Needed a place for myself, my mom, and 3 kids for the wkend. I wouldn't recommend this place. Overall it was clean, quiet, but not worth the $350/nite. We had an oceanfront efficiency room. The units have 1 a/c unit in the wall by the door on the balcony. it does not sufficiently cool the bedroom. we had kids sleep on the foldout couch, and they froze as being next to the A/C blowing on them. the room was so small we had to fold/unfold each day for sleeping. There was no way the pool was heated outdoor; it was freezing. even the kids wouldn't get in. Indoor pool is tiny, heated, and REEKS too strongly of chlorine. Parking was a JOKE. you get only 1 pass for each room, which is crazy, and they don't even have enough parking for people staying there. One night we had to park in their overflow parking, which is 3-4 blocks away, and then navigate the busy main drag w/ the kids. Hotel is old, dated. Doesn't look to much like what is online. We stay in hotels all the time in OC during the summer, and I'd look elsewhere for this price!

Reviews.Title: “1 Good Stay; Another Bad Stay”
Reviews.Author: peedcl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at The Commander Hotel last year in one of the Ocean Front Suites. We had a fantastic experience and loved our room. We just got back from our 2nd trip and were not as happy this time around. We stayed in an Oceanview Efficiency this time, and what a difference it makes. We had 2 major complaints about the room: 1) the TV in the bedroom was 19'' and could not be seen from sitting on the bed. Since the efficiency is just one large room, we really couldn't watch the TV. We were there during some bad weather, so this was kind of a let down. 2) the rooms have NO curtains. There are blinds on the windows, but they did not do enough to eliminate the street lights at night and the sun light in the morning. We complained to the front desk, but they stated that NO rooms have curtains. My boyfriend and I thought this was really odd, since most people like to sleep in even a little on vacation. The reason the curtains were an issue this year is that the efficiencies have no wall separations between the bed rooms and the balconies. Overall, the hotel is great, the location is great, the breakfast place was wonderful, but if you plan on staying in to watch a movie or want to sleep in the dark, DO NOT STAY HERE. I'd recommend the hotel only to a friend if they could afford the Ocean Front Suites, since there is some separation between the bedroom and the balcony/windows.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, very friendly, nice location.”
Reviews.Author: zoosodn
Reviews.Content: 1. Nice location - on the boardwalk with easy access to beach. This part of the boardwalk is quiet which is nice -- no noisy shops blasting music at night. Simply take the tram-car to the end for excitement at night. 2. Nice, heated pool with bar/snack bar. Great place to relax after hanging at the beach. 3. My mom has problems walking and we appreciated ramps available everywhere - very handicap accessable. 4. The hotel restraurant only serves breakfast, however the bar is open at night. 5. The indoor pool is VERY small, but no one ever seems to use it. 6. Excellent water pressure and lots of hot water for showers. 7. I found the room decor lovely - old time feel which if you read the history about the hotel it makes sense. 8. Excellent staff - VERY, VERY friendly and helpful. 9. Cleaning staff were excellent. 10. Use the in-room safe. Very nice feature. Overall a great hotel in O.C., MD.

Reviews.Title: “what you need to know to survive the Commander”
Reviews.Author: sunshinestate9
Reviews.Content: Here's some information you will need to survive a stay at the commander 1. No WiFi. there is a small room off the parking area that allows two people at a time to get "hook up". With face book and kids....just leave the computer at home 2. no clocks in room. The call system doesn't work either so go down to the desk and get a wake up call. 3. no iron in the room. On a brighter note there are two irons total "nailed" to the wall in small very warm humid closets on two separate floors. Take a wash closth to prop the door open to the "closet". 4.Soap despensers like you find in gas stations are attached to the shower and sink walls. You do not get bar soap or shampoo. 5,do not complain, or make eye contact with the manager. She will do her level best to ruin your remaining stay. We were placed last on the "rom cleaning" for asking that a dirty diaper be reomved from the front steps last year, maid told us) 6.Restaurant keeps odd hours, no lunch is served. 7. I found the front desk to be nice excluding the manager (she is overweight, roughly 60, and well rough) 8. beds I would guess as old as the building, and hair dryers maybe too. I have stayed at this hotel since birth. Makes me sick they leave the Lynches on the wall (former owners) they would never have been a part of this. You will need sedatives, alcohol and aleeve to survive this vacation at the Commander hotel

Reviews.Title: “SOOO Not Worth the Money!”
Reviews.Author: polarislm
Reviews.Content: We do an annual girls weekend in O.C. We have stayed at The Commander before, but I do believe this is our last year. As other reviewers have stated, the rooms are dark, outdated and barely clean. As we were standing in line to check in, there were some other guests in front of us asking for some bathroom ammenities (shampoo, conditioner, etc.) and the lady behind the counter (who I believe was a manager or owner) laughed and told them she could offer them some that she has taken from other hotels that she stayed in. I honestly couldn't believe my ears! Yes, it's true, in the "living room" area your $269 a night buys you a vinyl sofa, a bakers rack with a 19" old television, a few chairs and a desk with no mirror above it (which would be nice considering this is the room with the best light from the windows). There is no telling when was the last time the mattresses have been updated, so unless you plan to drink alot and pass out, good luck sleeping on them! You also can rent a room which sleeps six, but most likely six people are not going to arrive in one vehicle. However, don't even think of asking for a second parking pass. The rude hotel staff will be quick to tell you 'One parking pass per room, you can park on the street"! Now, all that being said, the location is great. It is also nice to have the kitchenette with a full refridgerator in the room. But I can honestly say, you would be better off spending this kind of money some place else.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: mamabear0770
Reviews.Content: First of all, I initially made our reservations online for a family vacation....and, was leary to click on the "confirm" button due to previous reviews. This was my first mistake!! I thought, how bad could it really be & submitted the reservation & made the deposit ($253.00) .... I received a print out of our confirmation (very generic) .. so I placed a follow-up call to the hotel prior to departing for our trip. I spoke w/Pat, who was very curt & rude. Upon arriving at the hotel, who checked us in ... none other than PAT!! Yes! So, I asked to see the room, as I always do, .. Well, .. upon entering the room, it was dark, dreary, dirty and stunk! Not to mention, it was very 'make-shift' ... old, out-dated furniture, dingy linens, and a bakers rake held the very outdated, small TV. I was appalled! For the monies they were charging, I was expecting much more! The lobby was the nicest part of the hotel but the rooms and hallways and customer service did NOT exemplify the same!! So, ... I chose to "shop" around .. afterall, if you're going to spend 2g for the week for a family vacation, the room & hotel should offer something more than stink, dirt, gloom & poor customer service!! We found a wonderful hotel right down the street for less money & that offered sooo much more for our money!! The Grand Stow-away Hotel is AWEOME! Their rooms are spacious, bright, clean & their staff is curteous & all around wonderful!! We went back to the Commander to cancel our reservation. Again, Pat was very rude!! She informed me I would not be getting a refund and asked me to step around to the side of the desk & the supervisor would speak w/me -- (there were customers checking in). So, I stepped around to the side. She met me at the doorway. Again, I asked for a refund b/c their website was very misleading - their rooms were dirty, dark & I was NOT comfortable staying there. She again very rudely stated, "Well, we are not giving your money back" ... and, then she stated her supervisor was on a call and she'd be with me in a moment. So, I proceeded to educate other consumers about their service & their facilities... Pat opened the door & informed me I was being recorded and that I would have to leave the premises or they were calling the police. I instructed her that as an educated consumer I had every right to express my opinion per the consumer advocate act & per our constitution. I did leave the premises w/o being refunded. We very much enjoyed our stay at the Grand Hotel! I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone!! And, I want other families to understand the way this facility operates, especially during our rough economic times! Do NOT stay or stay at your own risk!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little getaway -- great location!!!!!!!! GREAT HOTEL!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: grimmcs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to get away for a couple of days. We found a great deal at the Commander Hotel -- so I booked a room. After booking and then reading the reviews I was afraid as to what we would find when we arrived. This Hotel was excellent. The staff was friendly -- the room was very clean and up to date. When we went on the beach we used the in room safe that is provided and had no problems what so ever!!!!!! We had the Promenade room, which was wonderful. Excellent view, except for the trees in front of the deck on the boardwalk -- that is the only thing that I would change. The trees need to be removed or trimmed. Everything else was awesome. Would definitely recommend this Hotel!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not really sure”
Reviews.Author: hawkmp
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my husband and baby. The place looks awesome from outside but inside it's just old and tired. The room looked clean but had a really old depressing feeling to it. Poor lighting and old furnishings make it sorta unpleasant. On the bright side, there were no bugs or anything like that. I don't think I'll stay there again unless I have to as a last resort. Oh one more thing, parking was a pain in the behind. Very little parking is available under and near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Keep your money with you!”
Reviews.Author: oceancitygoer
Reviews.Content: We went to the Commander 18 years ago. We had a bad stay. We had the same experience as ejhalpin from new jersey. We left our money in the frig. in a bag and when we returned from the beach my money was gone. The manager or owner didn't seem to concerned about it. She also told us that we should have used the safe. I think the safe would be for valuable items. Who wants to take your spending money and put it in the safe, and every time you want to buy something have to run to the front desk. You should be able to keep that with you. We were thinking about staying there this summer, thinking maybe it's changed, but I GUESS NOT!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “"What a Terrible Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: odohej
Reviews.Content: Where do I even start!!! The place was very dirty, the beds were from the 60's. We had the worst trip of our lives and left after two days!!! The staff was very nice but the hotel has not been updated since the 70's. I walked into the restaurant and walked out, it was so dirty looking. My overall experience with Ocean City was bad and I would never go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Commander”
Reviews.Author: GirlAthlete
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Commander hotel this summer and loved it for the following reasons... - great location and family friendly - outdoor pool was not overcrowded (There was a pool attendant at the entrance to the pool deck checking to make sure only guests of the hotel entered pool area.) - guaranteed parking spot (There are 3 lots. Two were close to the buildings and the other was a block away. One night we had to park in the farther lot and the security guard offered to walk back with us. This was not necessary because it was a short distance and the streets were lit.) - staff was friendly and accommodating. We arrived early and were allowed to use the parking lot and pool until our room was ready. - cleaniness- The staff cleaned our room daily and were willing to work around our son's nap time. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Commander. I liked the size of this hotel. Although it was a modern hotel, it still had that "ma and pa" feel to it. We look forward to another stay at the commander.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Commander”
Reviews.Author: m0m2tw0girls
Reviews.Content: The Commander Hotel was very impressive. The pool was a big hit, complete with a poolside snack bar. The decor was a bit goofy, but our oceanfront room was perfect for two very young children. It had a full size refrigerator, microwave and the beds were separate from the pull-out couch, TV and balcony, so we could put the kids to bed and still watch TV or sit on the balcony. The view from the oceanfront balcony was breathtaking, and the location was great. It was just a short walk to the amusement rides. The only downside was that the double beds were very small and uncomfortable. I would suggest checking into a queen or king bed, but I don't know if they are available. I also highly recommend the Skipjack Grill for dinner. The breakfast buffet was very underwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience at The Commander”
Reviews.Author: ckat24
Reviews.Content: I was quite satisfied with my stay at The Commander. The layout of the room was a bit awkward--there is no separation between the kitchen/living room area and the beds, so anyone sleeping hears everything else going on in the room. The kitchen area was tiny, but sufficient. The balcony was of ample size, and had a table with four chairs, as well as a lounge chair out on it. The towel rack supplied on the balcony was also convenient. As for the bathroom, there was both a bathtub and a shower stall. Maid service was good about providing enough towels, and the room was clean, on a whole. I did not frequent the indoor pool, but the outdoor pool was clean and moderately-sized. The pool attendant asked what room we were staying in, our last name, and whether or not we had any outside alcohol on us each time we entered, which got irritating. The poolside bar was rather pricey. The hotel's restaurant, the Skipjack Grille, was also a bit overpriced, but what do you expect for a boardwalk-front place? I only ate one meal there, and it was average. I did really enjoy the hotel's central location directly on the boardwalk and beach. Parking is bad, as has been mentioned. However, there is a bus that runs up and down the island all day and night, which can be ridden unlimited times for $2.00--I recommend taking advantage of it, in order to keep your car in a good spot.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rspeaker67
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights at the Commander Hotel on their website for August 11-14, 2007. What an awful place. We checked out after only 1 night.
