The only good thing was the location (on the boardwalk). We had a queen bed which was very uncomfortable. The 19" TV was on the other side of the room and nearly impossible to lay in bed and watch. There was no alarm clock in the room, and when I asked the housekeeping staff about it they didn't even understand what I was asking. Although our room had a balcony (overlooking Phillips parking lot) the patio door and floor-to-ceiling windows were covered only by between-the-glass mini blinds. There were no curtains whatsoever, so the room was lit up most of the night by Phillips parking lot lights, and early morning by the sun. When we complained we were told that none of the rooms had curtains so we left. I will commend the hotel on refunding the charges, although they initially refused to.

Reviews.Title: “Neat and Clean Ammenties?”
Reviews.Author: Cathlab_2003
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we stayed at the Commander. Over all the hotel was above average. We had an ocean front suite. The room was neat and clean.We had two double beds and a sleeper couch.For the fiveof us the room was just right. The bathroom was in the middle with a tub shower. There was a hair dryer. The soap and shampoo were in dispensors. We brought our own. When we needed towels the room service brought them very fastious. Only one time they questioned us why we needed more towels we would give them the dirty and wanted to exchange them. Unfortunately teenagers use more than one towel. the kitchen area was small. Basicly we only used the refrigerator. We had to go to another floor for ice. I only have two complaints!! One is with the pool keeper. He questioned me at length about where I was staying? I gave him the room number and he still was not satisfied. So, I went tothe manager about this there was no need for this.I know they don't want just anyone swimming there. There were locked gates.Also the pool closes at 7:00 PM. this was a real bummer. Also the parking is terrible!! After I arrived they told me to park three blocks away at a unsecure area.If I wait till 5:00 them you can find one when people leave for dinner. There are not enough spaces for the rooms. I counted 50 spaces for over 500 rooms. The front desk also said if you come next time come early in the AM so you can get a space. This was my two big complaints.

Reviews.Title: “$ 300. a night for parking 2 blocks away !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: OCMD69
Reviews.Content: Not really what I expected. First , I booked for 3 nights Thue thru Sat night. There was a problem at BWI Airport and I was running late. I called the Commander to tell them I was running late and that i would be arriving late Thur P M or early Fri A M.. When I arrived Fri , they had cancelled my room. They gave me another room that was ocean front like I wanted but on the 2nd floor not the top floor that I had requested. The key cards did not work all the time, so I had to return to the front desk for them to reprogram the key cards. My big complaint was the parking, Not enough of it. I had to park 2 blocks away crossing Coastal Hwy into an unguarded lot! For $300. plus a night I think I would be able to park at hotel lot under the two buildings. Never again at the Commander. I was not the only one complaining about the parking. Every time I pasted the front desk, someone was there complaining about the parking.

Reviews.Title: “Only for lovers of musical chairs (with cars)”
Reviews.Author: BeachMeditator
Reviews.Content: This was our second family stay here. The first was in 2006. I swore I would go somewhere else the second time but was lazy. Everything was OK except for one major deal breaking attribute. THERE ARE LESS PARKING SPACES THAN ROOMS. It's musical chairs with cars. Don't even think about moving your car to see the area! When we checked in at 3:00 there was only ONE open spot that we took. Coming back in at about 10:00 the first night there was no where to park. I dropped the family off and alternated between circling the small area every 15 minutes and parking in position to grab a spot when someone moved. I was very tired and aggravated that it took almost an hour until someone left so I could pull in. The staff informed me that the original place built in 1930 was torn down for this version. Why in the #$@% didn't the design allow for enough parking spaces? I thought it was a law. If not, it should be! They will tell you, however, that there is an overflow lot to park in...three blocks away that I drove by. It was very secluded, no cars in it, looked like a dump, low lights, and they might as well put up a sign here that said "steal these cars". There was no way I would even consider parking there and then walking back to the hotel at night. The area by this lot looked very seedy. As a result of this all we could do for several day is walk up and down the boardwalk and only eat at places there. I was planning on doing this for part of the vacation anyway but I really wanted to see what else was in Ocean City. If I ever come back I will never stay here and my first and most important question to any other hotel will be to make sure there is sufficient parking.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Pleasant Experience for Me!”
Reviews.Author: travvlgyrl08
Reviews.Content: Me, my two daughters and five grandkids stayed at this hotel June 26th thru 29th. This was our first time in Ocean City. We arrived a little early but our rooms were not ready. We knew that check-in wasn't until 3 p.m. but we just tried anyway! Our rooms were ready around 3:10 p.m. The check-in staff were friendly. We had two oceanfront suites--they were a little dated, but clean. The beds were extremely hard!! The rooms had no ironing board or iron. But instead had a small laundry room on the second floor, where you could iron. They didn't have any toiletries, but had wall mounted dispensers for hand soap and body/hair shampoo??? I didn't have any problems with the cleaning staff, but my daughters said they were very unfriendly to them when they asked for more towels for the kids. The hotel staff, in general was friendly but a little stand-offish. I have stayed at my share of motels and hotels, but for some reason I felt very uncomfortable in this one. My daughter and I went to the pool bar--the bartender was not friendly at all; we asked about drink specials--he acted as if we were bothering him! We ordered mojitos--which cost $5 and were terrible!!! We did eat at the restaurant at the hotel--The Skipjack; the food was very good and the staff there were so friendly and pleasant that we went back a couple of times! Ocean City had a lot to do on the boardwalk, so my grandkids had a great time. This hotel is on the boardwalk, but I don't think I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: DeoVolente
Reviews.Content: The hotel accommodations were slightly below what you would expect from any of the beach hotels along the Ocean City boardwalk. There was not anything spectacular about the hotel that would make it stand out from any of the others. The worst part of this hotel is the staff. The entire staff was arrogant and self-loathing, particularly the red head manager with the black lipstick. Do not stay at this motel unless you are accustomed to a geriatric ward or a nursing home. If your lights are not out by 8pm she will be watching your every move! Smoking is also not tolerated even on the balcony. Remember, if you do smoke, you are being watched and will be caught and asked to vacate as well. A little tolerance and hospitality goes a long way. Neither of which this hotel offers!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ylleknai
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Commander last summer during white marlin and we loved it!! Our room was beautiful and clean. The maids did a wonderful job and our room was always very clean. The desk staff was very courteous and helpful. We stayed in an oceanview efficiency and the view was beatiful. We had a view of the beach and the bay. The skipjack grill is a great place for breakfast and the indoor pool is small but nice for a brief dip after the beach or on a rainy day. The only thing i did not like was the outdoor pool guard...he required your name and room number before he would let you in. It was just a little annoying, but other than that, i would highly recommend the Commander. In fact, we liked the Commander so much that we are going back this year with our family!!! it is a wonderful location, you are on the boardwalk but far enough away from the commotion that you have peace and quite at night. Would definately recommend. Very clean, quite, nice staff and an all around great hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 5oclocksomewhere
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Commander Hotel in Ocean City for three nights in April. Location was excellent, exactly midway on the boardwalk. Check-in was a breeze and desk clerks were very friendly. Oceanfront suite was only $82 per night and the weather was perfect. Very clean and quiet. Maid service very prompt and courteous. My only dislike was the darkness of the sleeping area walls with very formal faux window treatments and very dim lights. Seemed very un-beachy ! Also, do not plan to "swim" in the indoor pool as it's the size of a breadbox. All together, a wonderful place and I will definitely go back! P.S. Anthony's Deli on 28th St. Excellent subs/sandwiches but very pricey!! Dumsers - Best ice cream (several locations) Thrashers -Best fries ANYWHERE!! On the boardwalk

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in OC!”
Reviews.Author: Love2travel184
Reviews.Content: After stayng in dive after dive for 25 years in OC, we stayed here last August during the White Marlin Festival. Rooms were clean and beautiful. We stayed in the cabana suite. It was just my husband and I (the room actually slept 6 people) so we had tons of room. I have already booked my trip for this year at the Commander. Awesome pool with bar also! Great location and super friendly check -in staff! I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Commander”
Reviews.Author: chloeMaryland
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this motel last year and the service, staff and view was excellent. Was very pleased and had a beautiful view. The only problem I saw was the parking. Once you get there don;t leave or you may find it hard to get another parking spot. In fact, we plan on staying there again this year and bringing more people with us.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TWSA
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful vacation! My husband and I spent four days at Ocean City (Oct. 1 – 4, 2007). We hadn’t been there for many years and didn’t know where to stay anymore so we did research on tripadvisor. We were looking for a place on the beach, with a balcony and ocean view, about halfway down the boardwalk, reasonable rates, quiet, and clean. We found everything and more at the Commander Hotel. We did not make any reservations ahead of time. Because this was the off-season, we didn’t think we would have any trouble finding a room. And besides, we like to look at our room before we check in. (My husband is known for going from hotel to hotel before he finds a room that satisfies him. If it is not clean and smells good, we keep on going.) Based on our criteria, the Commander was our first choice. My husband went in to scout it out and the first thing he liked was the friendly and helpful people at the front desk. The next thing he noticed was how clean everything was. PJ took him up to look at a room. (Oceanfront Suite, 7th floor, $99.00) Thanks to tripadvisor, we knew to ask for a room on a higher floor away from the restrant. The room was perfect. The layout was exactly as they advertised and was beautifully decorated. Exactly what we expected. And clean! We did not have to check out another hotel, which means high praise from my husband! We especially liked having two televisions and the nice kitchenette. The vinyl sofa was very practical for the beach (especially if you had kids with wet bathing suits). It didn’t bother us – we just threw a blanket over it. We could have used an alarm clock, but we knew to bring our own, so no problem. The beds were the farthest distance away from the balcony, but at night we could leave the balcony door open and listen to the waves easily. If you do not have any children, we would highly recommend visiting Ocean City during the week in the off season. We wanted peace and quiet, and we got it. There was hardly anyone there! Room rates are way down and there is no traffic or lines. We had front row parking at the Commander every time we returned from driving around. You can ride your bike on the boardwalk all day instead of just in the morning. When we were younger, we used to love walking the boardwalk. I knew I physically couldn’t go the distance anymore, and I felt bad that I would miss this activity. But to my joy, we found that they rent tandem surreys which can be pedaled by two people (or one strong husband and a wife with a bad knee). They also rent electric wheelchairs (hover-rounds). What a convenience for the elderly! We were looking forward to eating seafood on this trip and really enjoyed the buffet at Phillip’s Crabhouse on 17th St. ($28) The different restaurants have different buffets and different prices, but we found this one was well worth it. Everything was delicious and it satisfied my craving for seafood. Our vacation was made so much nicer because of tripadvisor. Some of the entries can be really helpful. But others have to be taken with a grain of salt. Individual problems can turn up everywhere and people don’t always give both sides to the story. But if you read all the entries you can get an overall feeling for a hotel. We will be coming back next year and staying at the Commander. For us, there is no reason to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Commander Disappoints”
Reviews.Author: klea73
Reviews.Content: The Commander Ocean City Hotel sits directly on the famous boardwalk. I stayed in an Ocean Front room with two "queen" beds. The room was clean and the view was great. I requested an early checkin of 1pm, however I didn't get in until 3pm. It was slow season with many vacancies. There was no hand soap or an iron in the room. There were two very small 26" TVs in the room. The couch was awful. We paid $89 for slow season and I would suggest not paying over $100 at any time of the year. Not my first choice for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Excursion77
Reviews.Content: ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE HOTEL. If you have the option, please do not stay here... there are several other oceanfront hotels in the same price range that actually have clean rooms, respectable management, and adequate maid service. Ive been going to Ocean City since 1991 and this hotel was by far the worst experience Ive had. couples, families, young people...avoid this hotel and their rude management at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Duck, Duck, Goosed!”
Reviews.Author: PickYourPoison
Reviews.Content: Yikes! This place needs work. I booked an efficiency for a 3-night stay but got bumped to a smaller room. After a vague excuse and no apology, the concierge said that "overbooking" was a standard practice for most hotels. I was refunded only 10% of my deposit and told to contact a manager on my own dime. How rude! My kids and I were cramped in some tiny square room with 1 bed that had moldy ceilings and smelled like vegetable beef soup. The mildew in the bathroom was the worst. Yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Commander Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ColonRN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Commander 8/26-8/30/2007! I picked this hotel after reading all of the positive reviews on Tripadvisor.com! The location was perfect, it was great to be right on the boardwalk but not down where the noise was. We have a 21 month old son so it was very convenient to walk right out to the beach for awhile and then go right back to our room for him to nap. We also chose this hotel because in the room there is a separation between the main sleeping area and the living area. While it would be nice if there was a door, this prevented us from being stuck tiptoeing around in the dark after my son went to bed. We put our pack n play in front of the bed and it was dark enough that we could watch TV in the other room and even sit out on our porch! We had a promenade suite on the first floor and this was also convenient to not have to take the elevator to go to the beach. We enjoyed walking on the boardwalk at night (you can easily walk down to the rides at the end). The pool was nice for young kids, too, because it has a zero entry ramp which my son could easily play on. Parking was the main negative on this website, but we did not have a problem. One time we had to park at a lot down the street, but we moved our car the next morning to a spot right in front of the pool. We didn't have to do much driving because of the great location. If you love Italian food, eat at Angelo's at 33rd street:) We ate there twice:) I would definitely stay at the Commander again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed to say the least”
Reviews.Author: emd1
Reviews.Content: I contacted the hotel in early June and reserved an oceanfront rm for 4 nights at the end of August. I specified that I wanted an oceanfront rm with the standard lay-out as pictured on the website, where you enter the bedrm area, then there is a small kitchenette, and then the living area on the oceanfront w/balcony, as I knew I would have to work some while there and wanted the distance btwn the bedrm. and living area to be set away from my teenager while I had to work. When I got to the hotel I had been assigned a corner oceanfront room on floor 2. This is the exact type of room I did NOT want, as it is one small efiiciency-type room, with no division at all btwn. the beds and living area. Also, it had only 1 TV instead of 2, and the website advertises 2 for oceanfront rooms (one in bedrm and one in living area). The rm. was very hot (due to being a corner rm?) and wouldn't cool down in over 1 hr. Also, the rm looked right out onto the lo-n-g and wide roof of the restaurant, w/the beach in the distance- not exactly the oceanfront view I paid for. I talked to the manager who said there were no other rms and that he could not move me until the next day, and even then he did not know if another oceanfront rm. would be available. He tried to tell me that my rm. was an oceanfront rm., even though I had specified that I did NOT want a corner room and that I had to have the other separated layout and was told I would get it when I reserved. I checked out and went down the street 2 blocks to the wonderful Holiday Inn Oceanfront. More expensive, but guess what- I got a real oceanfront rm. there and they didn't try to pretend I had something different. Beware- Commander may try to pass off these much smaller corner efficiency-type rooms on you (w/one TV and absolutely no separation btwn the beds and living areas, and lokking out over the roof of the bar/restaurant- totally different than the oceanfront pics on the website) when you are paying for a real oceanfront room like the ones pictured on the website. Even if you specify that you do not want a coner room beforehand. It was a big hassle to have to unload the car in the heat, move in the hot room, deal w/this, and then move out to another hotel after this hassle and being told I HAD been given the right type of room when I had not.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PATraverler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Commander Hotel the last week of August and had a wonderful time. The hotel is close to the beach and has a little outside faucet to rinse the sand off your feet before entering the hotel. The front desk and housekeeping staff were very friendly and accommodating. We had a problem with another guest feeding the sea gulls on the balcony below us, called the front desk, and it was taken care of immediately. PJ is as pleasant as other posters have stated. The rooms are nice, but the only thing that came close to a negative is that they need to replace the sofa bed. It smelled very musty and you couldn't sit on it because the pillows would sink down into the sofa. We had breakfast at Skippack Jack's and it was very tasty and the servers were great. We would highly recommend staying there and would return on future trips to OC.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay here”
Reviews.Author: mmazz22
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this hotel. Still love it. First room had a crappy view of the ocean,(dont stay on the second floor in the first four units. very obstructed view) the hotel was nice enough to give us another room. the nicest thing about it was that they had us put our luggage on the bed and leave the hanging stuff hanging and leave our sodas etc in the refrig and they moved us! it was awesome. PJ as always the best, were gonna miss you PJ! My only complaints and they are the same every year, clocks, get clocks in these rooms, its sucks not to know what time it is in the middle of the night! PJ told me that the clocks were always getting stolen thats why they no longer have them in the rooms. My other complaint is no wireless, highspeed internet for the rooms. come on guys step up to the times and get wireless for the rooms. I appreciate the little highspeed cubicle in the lobby but the room would be much more convient. Also dont know why when they built the place they did nt put the beds in the room that hears the ocean. but all in all another great stay. spotless property and nice people working there.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Commander!”
Reviews.Author: MimmiNJ
Reviews.Content: I have visited OC Maryland a couple of times before and I have never liked any of the hotel rooms I have stayed in. I am so picky about hotel rooms, I bring my own sheets and comforter just so I can throw it away after the trip. I decided to pick the Commander because of the many great reviews. The front desk was very friendly upon checking in. Parking is far but we got lucky and found a spot right outside the hotel. We walk everywhere anyway so parking didn't matter much. I was pleasently surprised when I got into the room. It was spacious and very clean.It had plenty of room for the four of us. The big fridge definatly helped. The rooms are a little outdated as far as color scheme, but who cares if it is clean. Our cleaning lady, I think Leanne was her name was fantastic! Everyone there is super nice. I just hope they keep up the good work so I can stay there next year. The location is great and would recommend this place if you are as picky as I am. We didn't do SkipJack for breakfast but they had great apps and happy hour dollar drafts.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful when registering”
Reviews.Author: weesypittsburgh
Reviews.Content: We had a weeks stay booked through the internet with deposit paid. When we arrived with all seven of us, we were refused a room with new news that they have a fire policy that they only hold up to maxium six guests,when we booked on line four kids and three adults it didn't print up four kids because my son is only one year old who is concidered free,so we had no where to stay,with four children who were ready to go to the beach, my son needed a breathing treatment because he has asthma and the women behind the counter where ingnorant and pretty much said sorry we can't accomidate you in any way. We waited an hour for a manager who gave us back our deposit and called another hotel four blocks away, not oceanfront......which we had. So if your concidering......I wouldn't give them the satisfaction and find a better place.We were unaware of this policy because there was no where stating this fact online,which is pretty dumb.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sherick02
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4-night stay at the Commander. "We" consists of my husband and I, our 5-yr old twins and our 2 year old. We stayed in one of the ocean view Navigators Suites on the 7th (top) floor. There was plenty of room for all of us, including the pak-n-play we brought for our 2 yr old. The layout was spacious with a separate room with a living room/dining area. Also provided was a full-size refrigerator which really came in handy. Off our room was a huge double-sized balcony with a beautiful view of the ocean and bay. The rooms were very clean, the front desk staff was pleasant and very helpful. Housekeeping was excellent. The outdoor pool was great, and so was the indoor one - small, but nice. The location on the boardwalk was very convenient. Far enough up the boardwalk to not have huge crowds, but close enough to be able to walk pretty much anywhere. I can't say much about the on-site restaurant. We had the breakfast buffet there one morning, and it was average at best. The price was reasonable, though. However, there were a few things that the Commander could definitely improve upon. The headboards on our beds seemed not to be attached properly. Every time you accidentally touched the headboard, they made a loud, horrible sqeak. Also, for anyone anticipating using the pull-out sofa bed in the living room as an extra sleeping area - DON'T! Our twins wanted to try it out just for fun. I would not allow them to sleep on it. The mattress was very thin, and you could feel every spring. I can't imagine anyone being able to get 5 minutes of sleep on that sofa bed. It also would have been nice if they had even a curtain to allow some privacy between the bedroom and the living/dining room. That seems like such a simple, inexpensive thing to do and it would add so much to the room. Also, the only ceiling light fixture hangs right between the bedroom and living area. If the kids are sleeping, you may have to sit in the dark so you don't wake them up with the bright light shining on their faces. We ended up moving a lamp from the bedroom into the living room just to be able to see at night. By far, the most inconvenient thing about the Commander was the parking. It's horrendous! They have very limited parking at the hotel. For three of the four nights we were there, we had to park in their satellite lot, which is about 2 blocks away. (About a 5-10 minute walk.) Not a big deal, but with 3 kids it was a pain. That is the only thing that would make us possibly look for a different hotel the next time we visit Ocean City. Overall, the Commander is a great value with a great location. I would definitely recommend a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: north_coast_guy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay in Ocean City. Overall, I would rate the Commander as a very good value. The room was clean and neat. Maid service was excellent. We had an issue with a noisy fan in our air conditioning unit. We stopped at the desk before breakfast to report the problem. We had just returned to our room after eating when a repairman arrived. Within 15 minutes the problem was fixed. The Commander is on 14th street. This put us squarely in the middle of the boardwalk, which essentially runs from 1st to 28th. Although a fair hike, my son and I were easily able to walk all the way to the inlet. If biking is more your style, there is a rental place right next door; although bicycles on the boardwalk are prohibited after 10 AM. The hotel restaurant is called the Skipjack Grille. We only ate a couple breakfasts there, but I can say that the meals we had were very average. We found better places nearby. I can't speak to the lunch and dinner menus. I would recommend The Commander to anyone planning a stay in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: OhDolphin
Reviews.Content: This will be my 3rd stay at the Commander !! My only real complaint is the bath towels....poor quality and too small. So, this year I will bring my own . It's a great hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: beaches07
Reviews.Content: this was our second time staying at the commander and i know i would stay there again. we had an oceanfront room with an awesome view of the beach from our little sun deck that leads to the main sun deck. the hotel was clean and i had no problems with the staff. we only had two problems with the stay. first was parking. it was horrible. we had to park 2 blocks away. we got lucky our last night and got a parking space in the lot under the hotel. however the hotel is on the boardwalk so you can walk to many different things, so it wasn't that bad. the other bad thing that we experienced was when our air conditioning made a loud, horrible noise during the night (all the other guests prolly heard it too). however neither of these would stop me from ever staying their again. i do recommend this hotel.. i know i would stay their again, hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “The Commander is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MarylandMomOfTwins
Reviews.Content: I have never felt so comfortable in a hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful, and went out of their way to make sure that my family had everything that was needed. The room was very clean and nicley decorated. It was like our home away for home while we were there, and we have decided that when we go to Ocean City, we will only stay at the Commander.

Reviews.Title: “No thanks...this is no Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: letsgotothebeach
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hilton four times over the last six months, but my kids have been dying to stay at the Commander since it's on the boardwalk. We got our chance this week. We were at the Hilton for three nights, and when we checked out, our van broke down (naturally, right!?). The Hilton welcomed us back, but the kids said it's the perfect time to try something different...the Commander. After the reviews, I thought it looked interesting myself. The front desk was less than sympathetic to our situation, and would not even upgrade us at 6pm even though they had many, many rooms available. We chose an oceanview suite (the layout was nicer than oceanfront, and the view was good). We were there about two hours when we couldn't take it anymore. The TV didn't work, the sofa was such a yucky plastic thing, the dishes were dirty, the heat barely worked, the beds and headboards were rickety, and the halls were very dark and kinda creepy. I was traveling with the kids alone while my hubby had to work. We are not hotel snobs, but when an 8 and 10 year old boy actually notices these things, it's pretty bad. My 10 year old actually got creeped out and started to cry! The pool was cold, and they didn't provide towels. The soap and shampoo "dispensers" were at least a foot over my younger sons' head! I will say that they were generous to let us check out without penalty when we weren't happy. Guess what...we went right back to the Hilton! They were so concerned about what we went through that day, they gave us an upgraded suite and charged us less than our initial 3 days because they knew we had a tough day. Bare in mind this rate was only $20 more than the Commander, and it was like going from driving a Pinto (remember them?) to a Mercedes. We all agreed....it's the Hilton or we don't go to OC at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel--GREAT Location!”
Reviews.Author: PghParrothead
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a stay for us and her two children (Ages 4 & &7) at the Commander last summer after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. We have taken many trips to Ocean City back in our young single days and stayed in many of OC's boardwalk hotels--some nice and some not-so-nice. We loved the Commander! The location is perfect--right smack in the middle of the boardwalk! The Ocean front suites are spacious with seperate living and sleeping areas--great to put the kids into bed and us to drink wine and play Scrabble in the living area. The rooms were also clean without the traditional OC musty beach smell. The funky couch that others have mentioned in reviews was ok--we put a sheet over it to make it more comfortable to sit on. (the only bad thing we have to say about the room is the kind of strange liquid soap dispenser in the bathroom--bring your own bar soaps!) The kitchenette was perfect for breakfast and lunches in the room which helps the budget because OC hotels are not cheap in the summer. A full size fridge, micowave and toaster as well as the all important coffee pot are provided. We had a very bad experience when my niece became very ill after eating a local seafood buffet. She had to be taken to the hospital via ambulance on the day we were to check out. The front desk staff were wonderful and very accomodating with a late check out and were more concerned about her well being than getting us out of the room in time. If you are looking for a high class hotel, the Commander is not the place for you. But if you appreciate Ocean City for it's charm and are looking for a spacious, clean hotel with a great staff in the perfect boardwalk location, then stay at the Commander! We are planning to return this summer--but we won't be going to any seafood buffets!

Reviews.Title: “This IS a NON-SMOKING Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tojojijo
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel because they are very happy to accomodate people with chemical sensitivites or allergies and they don't have an attitude about it. Please note if you are a smoker, this IS a NON-SMOKING Hotel, HOWEVER, I understand that you can smoke if you book in the Cabana Bldgs. I was told that Smoking isn't allowed on the balcony of the Non-smoking building. With Chemical Sensitivity, I can't merely walk away. Once I am exposed, the damage is done. I will have chest pain, trouble breathing and a migraine, along with Rhinosinusitus, for the duration of my trip and months after. For this reason, I choose a non-smoking hotel, so if you are a smoker, please specify the cabana bldg when booking. The last time I looked, the website did state it was non-smoking. The service/staff at this hotel has always been great. If we needed something, they took care of it right away, or let us know why it wasn't taken care of. Housekeeping was excellent. As far as the restaurant goes, it's not that great, (and it does allow smoking for those interested). But there are some great places to eat nearby. Right next door is Davinci's. A little farther up, I think 17th street is Oceanview Grill. The have a great deal for a Clambake for 2. Very reasonable I thought. We got carry out and took it back to our room and had a bottle of wine with it on the Beautiful Captain's Suite balcony. And for Pizza you will find Franko's between 14th and 18th, somewhere on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “3rd times a charm.”
Reviews.Author: jerseydevil77
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time in 4 Years that We Stayed at the Commander and it was a Great Stay once again.The Staff are very friendly and Helpful.We Stayed in the Captain's Suite,What a Room! The Commander has the Biggest Balconies(Private Balconies I would add)That I have ever stayed in.We Hope to be Staying at the Commander again in '07.The Prices were reasonable for the Location which is right on the Boardwalk in Ocean City and Centrally Located on the Boardwalk too.Great Restaurants Close by you can't go wrong staying at the Commander.ASG.

Reviews.Title: “So what if there is a vinyl covered couch, this hotel has P.J.!!!”
Reviews.Author: FairtoEveryone
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Commander Hotel for one night during Labor Day week in September. Unfortunately, it was right after spending two nights at the new Hilton Suites on 32nd street. That did not bode too well for the Commander in comparison, especially as it was more expensive than the Hilton. However, the woman at check in, P.J., was simply outstanding and put the check in staff at both the opulent Hilton and rather cold Crystal Beach Hotel to a distant 2nd place. P. J. is a very pleasant, cordial and welcoming person. She is, what my parents used to always say about meeting good people in life, a real ( non phony ) person. I hope the Commander knows how incredibly fortunate they are to have her as she truly epitomizes what the word "service' really means in the hotel industry. Thank you, P. J. for your kind welcome to the Commander. I thought of her as almost a new friend immediately. How often does THAT happen when you check in to a hotel? I think the Hilton should steal her from the Commander and make her the concierge up there. It would be the best decision the Hilton could make. The guests would adore her. About the Commander. It has an excellent location on14th street. I had an oceanfront room and private balcony overlooking the boardwalk which was nice. The room was clean and the infamous vinyl couch did not bother me at all. ( Maybe I am low class. ) In general however, I found the accommodations to be just adequate, roomy enough for 2 to 4 people but also rather outdated and even a little funny after the magnificent ( cheaper ) Hilton. The beds were acceptable and limited kitchenette supplies okay. There is a full size refrigerator which is of course a plus. No stove, just a microwave. Parking is on site and no problem at all. The restaurant served acceptable to good food at a reasonable price and provided staff who gave good service. P.J. suggested I take a look at the Cabana rooms located right behind the main building. I thought they were definately nicer with a better room layout and obviously more roomy than the oceanfront room I had. Of course my view was better. While some of the Cabanas have a limited side view of the ocean that is not bad, you can't compare it to being direct oceanfront. The outside pool is directly in front of the Cabana accommodations while the quite small indoor pool is in the main building. Would I stay here again? Probably not in any rooms located in the main building unless the cost was less , especially during high season. I do not personally feel they are worth it otherwise. I would consider a cabana room as all you have to do is walk a few steps and you are on the boardwalk oceanfront. I got the sense that this hotel has a loyal, annually returning clientle, and that certainly says something for it. However, the Commander faces stiff competition, and not just from the Hilton. In most ways Crystal Beach Hotel is nicer and I am willing to bet Park Place, Paradise Plaza and the new Breakers are as well. After walking along the Boardwalk and seeing other hotels and reading reviews on tripadvisor, i would not ever stay at either the Monte Carlo or the Tidelands Caribbean over the Commander. P. J. would not put up with some of the stuff happening to customers that obviously goes on at those 2 places for more than about 5 seconds.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanfront Views on Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: treki999
Reviews.Content: Large rooms with comfortable beds and sleeper sofa. 2 cable TVs. No High Speed. Large balcony for two people to stretch, sit, read or sleep. Avoid Room 206 Balcony is directly over SlipJack Resturant. Other hotel guests like to feed to pigeons so every morning I woke up to that sound. Note: 2 to 3 screened windows that open for cross breezes also Balcony door opens up but does not have a screen. Bathroom: Basic needs no super soaker tub. Kitchen: Large refrig. Medium size microwave. Large enough to heat up large meals.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in OC”
Reviews.Author: perfectflaws
Reviews.Content: After years of visiting Ocean City, this is the first time we stayed at the Commander. It was last minute and only a cabana was available. We were very impressed with everything. The room was lovely and the staff was courteous and friendly. The pool is nice and big and stays open late. The only problem we had was that the pool was constantly occupied by a large, obnoxious family but, of course, that was not the fault of the Commander. As a matter of fact, they were very polite to them and that must have been hard. The indoor pool is fabulous! It's large and has very nice seating around it. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay at the Commander!”
Reviews.Author: Atreyu627
Reviews.Content: We were drawn to the Commander by good reviews and good location, and we were not disappointed. Parts of the hotel seem to have been redone in recent years and it really shows. The lobby is beautiful and creates a great first impression, paired with an incredibly friendly staff (PJ is the nicest lady I've ever dealt with at a hotel front desk!) While nothing about our room was overly fancy or luxurious, it was beautiful and just what we wanted. We had an oceanfront suite and I would recommend that type of room to anyone. It was much more spacious than we had imagined, and I can't say enough about the overall cleanliness of the room and the hotel as a whole. The maid service was wonderful and they were all so very friendly. While an ideal location for a pool is on the beach, the pool behind the hotel was excellent. The poolside bar had great drinks at reasonable prices (we didn't try the food but it looked delicious). Friendly staff there as well. The main restaurant, "The Skipjack Grill" was pretty good. We had a great burger one day for lunch. The breakfast buffet was not overly impressive, but I'm not a big breakfast fan anyway. There were only a few downsides to our stay. We didn't care for the vinyl couch, lack of clocks, and liquid soap dispensers in the bathrooms. Also, the front of the hotel is angled, which makes for a rather odd oceanfront view. We got used to it though. Overall, we had a wonderful experience at the Commander and I highly recommend it. We will most certainly book our next Ocean City vacation with The Commander!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: la4family
Reviews.Content: My family, friends and I were pleasantly surprised by our overall stay at the Commander. We arrived early on June 24th- even though our room was not ready at 12:00 noon. We were greeted by friendly staff and were given a parking pass. We spent the day at the beach and the friendly staff called us on the beach when our room was prepared. All of the staff was outstanding during our stay and we absoulutely loved our room. It was very comfortable, clean and roomy. We stayed in an oceanview suite and loved the two balconies. The room was beautiful. I also cannot say enough praise to our cleaning staff. Our room was cleaned by Guadalupe. Even though we never met her, we wanted to mention her name for the outstanding job she did duing our stay. It is very obvious that the owners of this hotel expect a high standard from their employees. We are already planning our vacation next year and we will definately revisit the Commander. Thank You to everyone that made our stay a very positive, unforgettable experience.

HotelInfo.Name: The Commander Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 14th St. and Boardwalk, Ocean City, MD 21842
